docTitle.titlePart:
Noncatalytic Cannizzaro-type Reaction of
Formaldehyde in Hot Water

byline.docAuthor: Yasuo Tsujino, Chihiro Wakai, Nobuyuki Matubayasi, and Masaru Nakahara

front.div:
In water at 25C and 4 MPa, methanol and formic acid are produced from the disproportionation
reaction of formaldehyde without a catalyst, although at mild conditions, this reaction usually occurs in
the presence of a large amount of base catalyst. Formic acid further undergoes the hydride transfer
reaction with formaldehyde, and the final yield of methanol exceeds 50%.
front.keyword: Keywords : Hydrothermal reaction / NMR / C 1 chemistry / Formaldehyde / Cannizzaro reaction
